description.narrative: NLRC-510 can help national societies identify their biggest opportunities to use data and digital (business value case mapping), to use a human centered design approach to collect user insights and use the development team technical knowledge to create a set of requirements for a solution. Based on the requirements our team can develop with the national society a rapid prototype that can be field tested and use on a small scale with aid workers and beneficiaries. With this user tested prototype the national society can work with 510 to implement the solution with one of their local or global IT and digital service providers and start a development or procurement of an operational platform. The handholding during this phase will increase the likelihood of national societies getting value out of their investments in data and digital technology. This service will help national societies to fast track their digital maturity, to prioritize the most valuable investments, and to do research and development properly, before using scarce resources to develop software or data science solutions.

The IFRC Digital Strategy will bring an increasing amount of data and digital work in the humanitarian programs of national societies. However, embedding digital technology in humanitarian operations is a real challenge.
The NLRC-510 development team/rapid prototyping team IFRC and the Movement National Societies

The objective of this project is to change the 510 development team to a rapid prototyping team with a clear global service offering to the IFRC Network, and to initiate a first set of support projects to national societies. When the service is initiated and national societies are requesting the services, the cost-recovery model of 510 will ensure the sustainability of the initial investment from the IH extra projects fund.

sector.narrative: Multisector aid for basic social services
